boat.construction_details: Pitch pine planking on grown oak frames
boat.full_description:
Gladimaris was originally Mizpah, a yawl-rigged Plymouth fishing boat (PH255) built in Stonehouse in 1885. In 1919 she was re-registered as Venture and cutter rigged to be used as a pilot boat out of Exmouth. She was replaced by a motor launch in 1934 and sold on to be converted into a cruising yacht. In 1938 she registered with Lloyds register of Yachts by the McNabb family and renamed after the owner’s spouse, Gladys Mary.

After a restoration in England in 1966 that replaced her deck with western cedar, and gave her all new spars(spruce mast pine gaff, bowsprit and boom) she was shipped from Tilbury to Vancouver as deck cargo at the end of 1975. Here her restoration continued as the shearstrake was replaced with teak and new bulwarks were fitted. The interior was finished with exotic woods. Gladimaris was still floating in 2024, but her new custodian is about to bring her ashore for a thorough restoration that will probably return her to her original dandy rig with standing lugsail aft.
boat.name: Mizpah
boat.short_description: Hull originally registered in 1885 as Plymouth Hooker PH255 Mizpah
